headline: Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo
description: Savory, sauteed chicken is cooked in a cheesy, creamy sauce with Roma tomatoes. The mixture is served atop a bed of fettuccini pasta.

video.description: See how to make quick-and-easy chicken Alfredo.
video.name: Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo

name: Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo
recipeIngredient: 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into cubes

recipeInstructions.text: In a large skillet over medium heat combine chicken, 2 tablespoons butter, 2 cloves garlic, and Italian seasoning. Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside. Remove from skillet and set aside.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.

Meanwhile, melt 4 tablespoons butter in the skillet. Saute onion, 2 cloves garlic, and mushrooms until onions are transparent. Stir in flour, salt and pepper; cook 2 minutes. Slowly add milk and half-and-half, stirring until smooth and creamy. Stir in Parmesan and Colby-Monterey Jack cheeses; stir until cheese is melted. Stir in chicken mixture, tomatoes and sour cream. Serve over cooked fettuccini.

review.reviewBody: Very good! I didn't use the sour cream because the sauce was so thick and I didn't even use all the shredded cheese. I didn't add tomatoes but did add thawed spinach right at the end to healthy it up a bit:)
Loved this recipe. I made as directed except I added 8 oouced of cream cheese with the other cheeses. It's on the menu again this week but in much smaller proportions for my husband and myself!
I've made this recipe several times and it's a favorite by those I've made it for
My family's favorite
This recipe was a hit with my wife and girls. Absolutely scrumptious! The girls wanted me to leave out the mushrooms and tomatoes but I left everything else exact. I will make this again for sure.

Was just making for my boyfriend so reduced everything appropriately. Added a bit extra sour cream as it was tasting a bit too cheesy. He gobbled it up and said it was great! Easy recipe and will definitely make again.
So delicious!!
Very, very good! This recipe is definitely a keeper. My only change is I added broccoli since I had it on hand.

I loved this recipe! But when I made it I wanted a little more the regular chicken Fettuccini so what I did was substitute the Italian seasoning with Cajon. I got the chicken and cut it up into bite size peices and put it in a bag with about 5 table spoons of Cajon seasoning shoot it up and let it sit for about 35 mins and then followed this recipe on how to cook the chicken, pasta, etc.. and man. It was so Good. My sister who refuses to eat any pasta anywhere because she hates it. Tried some of mine and fell in love. 

Highly recommend. 5/5 stars

I decided to try a homemade recipe because store bought alfredo sauce is DISGUSTING (IMO)!!! I discovered this recipe back in 2014, and I still use it to this day because it is so creamy and rich in flavor. This is better than any restaurant recipe I have ever had, and I love that it has fresh tomatoes in it! I follow this recipe to a T, and it always comes out amazing!!! THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH FOR SHARING THIS RECIPE WITH US! 7 years later I am still using this recipe, and I will NEVER try another one!
This meal was delicious.
Great recipe, changed a few things but turned out amazing will definitely be making again!!
My family loved this recipe. The only change I will make next time is to cut the chicken into slivers rather than into cubes.

I used buttermilk, the rest was according to the recipe. I think it was very good. I had to add about 1/3 cup more milk at the end of cooking to loosen it a bit. I like the reviews stating to try shrimp and some bacon crumbles. Will have to try that next time.

This is my go to dish when I’m cooking for people, it’s absolutely amazing. I follow the recipe exactly, except I usually leave out the mushrooms just for personal preference. Would absolutely recommend!!!
I found this to be quite bland despite all the cream. doesn't really seem worth all the extra calories when it doesn't add in terms of taste
I didn't have any cream, so I substituted some canned alfredo sauce. It was one of the best chicken fettuccini recipes I've ever made. My husband loved it.
Very rich and tasty. Omitted tomatoes, but otherwise followed the recipe. A tablespoon salt seemed like too much, so we only added 1 teaspoon.
This one just didnt do it for me. Didn't like the flavor profile

I'm not a huge fan of Italian food but I love a good Alfredo. This did not disappoint. Creamy but not heavy and easily adjustable. I added some broccoli to the pasta water for a quick minute then pasta & broccoli went directly into the sauce. The trace of pasta water that transferred helped to loosen the sauce while keeping it creamy. The sauce coated everything wonderfully. Finish with some crushed red pepper and enjoy!

Salty! There is no way on earth that 1 Tablespoon of salt is okay in this recipe. A half teaspoon salt is plenty on top of salty Parmesan and Colby-Jack. Salt addicts, feel free to add up to another 1/2 teaspoon if you find it lacking at the end, for a total of 1 teaspoon. If not for this, I believe to be error, this has a nice consistency and flavor. I hope that inexperienced cooks don’t take this highly rated recipe as face value.

I made the recipe with minor changes for my husband’s meal prep for lunch this week. I added in frozen mixed veggies to make it a little more balanced for his lunch. I did the steps a little different than stated, I made everything in the same pan without taking the chicken out. I cooked the chicken with the garlic, onions, and mushrooms because I wanted those flavors to be incorporated into the chicken. Cooking it all in the same pot also made clean up a bit easier. All in all, the ingredients work very well together. I will be adding it to our rotation.

I discovered this recipe 7-8 years ago and have made it probably 100 times or more. I don’t really change anything and it’s one of family favorites. I’ve sometimes had to replace cheeses or milk, sometimes I don’t have mushrooms on hand or I feel like improvising and adding some heat. Regardless, it’s always fantastic and never disappoints. Also reheats well so although the quantity is for 6-8 portions we have a lot of leftovers for the next day in our family of 4 and nobody is complaining.
It was really good !! Everybody loved it. The only difference I made was adding broccoli florets
Delicious. I added frozen broccoli to the pasta halfway through. Very tasty and it makes a LOT.
If some find the sauce not velvety smooth, or grainy, just shred your own cheese. Graininess comes from many of the store-bought shredded cheeses that add cellulose or flour.
Great recipe! Was a bit concerned that the sauce would come out orange because of the Colby jack cheese but no issues there.

No changes. Although it is a little thick it is amazing! It tastes better than any other fettuccine alfredo I've ever had. This is my go to recipe when I want to cook something for someone that I've never cooked for before. 5 stars!

this was absolutely delicious. reduced the servings to 4. . keeping the garlic at 4 cloves..used herb and garlic cheese (that's what I had) and used only 2 per cent milk. omg..the best recipe I've used from this site ever!
I made this recipe exactly and it came out terrible... wouldn’t make again. Not your typical Chicken Alfredo, I didn’t get adding the different cheeses but thought would try it. Very disappointed.
Very yummy!
Loved it!
Very good!

This recipe is soooooo creamy. It makes a LOT more than I expected so perfect for cooking for a group. I added bell peppers and some broccoli so I didn't have to feel quite so bad about the amount of fat, and it added a lot of color and texture. 

I had read reviews about there being too much liquid in the sauce so I only used 2 cups of milk and halved the sour cream. I also added more parmesan because I like the more bitter flavor. If I were to make it again, double the salt, and lessen the Italian seasoning (I used a very strong seasoning from France that ended up overshadowing the cheesy flavor a little).
very cheesy. very good. yummy
I have received so many compliments on this recipe. I love it.

I made some changes (using what I had on hand). I used rotisserie chicken which was already cooked. I poured the contents of step 1 over the chicken I had set aside. Since I had no half n half, I used 3 cups of 2% milk it came out thick and creamy but will get the half n half next time. I added broccoli with the tomatoes and that is when I put the chicken in to heat it up. It was colorful, thick and tasty.
Absolutely loved it.

great recipe! I ended up customizing the amount of some of the ingredients and used black pepper instead of white. also, instead of the mushrooms and tomatoes, I used broccoli and sun dried tomatoes. still tasted great with everyone asking for seconds!

My family and i thought this recipe was very good. i didn't add mushrooms because they don't like them, so i substituted a chopped red pepper instead. The recipe made a lot, and we had plenty of leftovers. i will definately make this again. it had more flavor then some restaurants. Very good.
my family really liked it alot but I wasn't crazy about it myself and it took a really long time to cook
Delicious! My family loved it. And the leftovers held together nicely.
Way too much flour in this recipe. Cut down the flour to 1/4 cup
Excellent dish, one of my favorites

my hubby and kids LOVED this recipe. only thing I did different was I added in broccoli and asparagus, and a tad more milk and cream to make it a bit less thick. besides that awesome recipe, will def be adding this to my collection of recipes.
Delicious and easy/quick to make, exactly as written!!

I only made a third of this recipe, and it was plenty for one of those smaller packages of “ fresh” fettuccini. The recipe was very forgiving (I missed the part where you cook the flour after your add it, and used the jack and cheddar I had on hand instead of a Colby jack mix).
Tasted ok but was grainy. Will not make again.
Turned out really good for me. i used shrimp and spaghetti noodles instead plus chopped mushrooms. ill be making this again.
I just made it without the mushrooms, but it turned out great!
It was Great! I left out the mushrooms, this time.
It was one of the best recipes that I’ve made off of allrecipes.com to date. My family chowed it down. Great flavor! It was delish!
I made it according to the recipe. The sauce was too thick and there was just too much cheese. Next time I will use half the cheese.

My family pretty much loved this recipe - including my picky daughter - even though I had to leave out the Colby cheese (none in the house). The only thing we will change going forward is omitting the sour cream - just because it wasn't to our taste.
This recipe was a hit with my family!! It was very good and I will definitely be making this again!!
Didnt have the cheeses, heavy cream or sour cream on hand, so did without them
My kids loved it! Said it was better than a restaurants!! Hubby enjoyed it to!!
Very rich and delicious sauce. I tried to use low fat ingredients to make it less heavy, like whole wheat pasta and low fat butter and fresh cream. The taste was so amazing..
I just added broccoli to the noodles about 4 min in and added everything to my big pot! My husband LOVED it. Made me feel like cooking is something not so far from reach!
Great recipe!!! Easy to follow instructions even for a newbie like myself! Highly recommend for everyone to try!
oh my word so good! My family loved it. This recipe is a keeper.
It was awesome and my boys loved it. I did add broccoli though
Very good

Left out a few things, like mushrooms and the jack cheese and halved the recipe. Consistency was good but it was lacking flavor. It was very bland in flavor, maybe the second cheese makes more of a difference than I thought?
Yummy! This is a favourite especially with fresh tomatoes, basil and oregano from the garden. Skipped the chicken for the vegetarians.

I made itit was great with some changes i cut the milk to have and used chicken stock insted and i add oregano and 2 spoons of sour cream 
I was yummy 
Thanks

I made it and did it with a twist. I took the juice from the chicken and placed it in a pot and made the alfredo sauce without sauteeing the veggies - just skip that step and do the flour and butter and salt step. Then since my hubby likes mushrooms and onions; I poured the sauce over and mixed in the chicken with the sauteed mushrooms and onions. For me, I took the remainder of the sauce and added steamed broccoli and tomatoes to it with the other half of the chicken. 1 recipe 2 dishes lasted 3 days. That's a winner!!
Not a fan of mushrooms, tomatoes, and sour cream but everything turned out great will definitely make it again

I made this as written omitting the tomatoes and mushrooms only cuz my family preferred it without. I on the other hand would have liked to have tried it with them. A 4 star review from my tough critics is darn good!!! I do agree that the recipe could use more chicken as it does make a lot of sauce. We liked it a lot and I will definitely be making it again!
Made this the first time for my wife, she loved it. It`s very easy to make and we could not eat it all.
The only change I made was to cut the recipe in half. Best chicken alfredo i have ever tasted. Would definitely make this again.
I think the sauce taste amazing! I used more pasta though to make make it less runny. Also, my fiancé doesn’t like tomatoes or mushrooms (bummer), so I did corn and peas instead!
This was GREAT. Everyone loves it and couldn’t stop talking about it!!! We just added a little bit of obay , I made one with chicken one with seafood. This is a forever keeper.
Family loved it. Leftovers were just as tasty!
So delicious!!!!

This dish is phenomenal!! My boyfriend and I are in college and make this on special occasions. Its easy enough to make and is just a really special meal. Best fettuccine we've ever had honestly, highly recommend!
Excellent! My family loved it! Will certainly make again.
I halved the recipe. The only change I made was to use almond milk instead of cows milk. It still came out great! Give this recipe a try.
We made it into a casserole!
My family loved it! I reduced half the amount of cheese and everyone liked it. Thanks !
I like it with sausage along with chicken
This was absolutely delicious! Definitely a keeper. Will make again and again.

Loved it and it was so easy. I didn't have any mushrooms in the house nor fresh tomatoes but it was still really good without them. Next time I'll plan ahead and will include them. My husband who doesn't like Parmesan cheese thought it was delicious. I think the addition of the Colby/jack cheese made a big difference by giving it a cheesy flavor without it just being Parmesan flavor.
This was a huge hit with my mother and two sons! Absolutely delicious!

I was excited to try this recipe - with an overall rating of over 4 stars, with over 1,000 reviews I thought it must be fantastic. My teenage-son, who eats everything and has never met an alfredo sauce he doesn't like, barely touched it. 
I personally think it has potential - but there are changes I'd make for next time.
1. I don't understand the use of Colby/jack cheese in it - it made the sauce yellowish instead of white and the flavor just isn't what you'd expect. 
2. the quantity of cheese is way too much - makes this more of a cheese sauce rather than alfredo. Next time, I'd use about half the amount asked for.
3. I was ok with tomatoes, but suggest tossing them in at the end, and make sure you use roma - I didn't have roma, only had garden tomatoes. They broke down in the sauce. I was ok with this from a flavor perspective, but they ended up becoming part of the sauce rather than pieces of tomatoes. Also, taken together with the yellow cheese, gave the sauce overall an orange flavor. 
4. The quantity - this makes a ridiculous amount of sauce. Seriously - there were 6 of us, two being teenage boys, and we have enough leftovers for 2-3 more meals. Next time, I will half this recipe.
Best. Recipe. EVER!
Very good. Substituted black pepper for white pepper. Would probably use white pepper next time.
One of my favorites!
It was very good, but too heavy of a meal for me.
Made this last week and enjoyed it. This was also the first time I had to half a recipe so that was an interesting challenge.

This is the first recipe I ever found on Allrecipes and I have made this more than a dozen times with a few minor alterations. The sauce is the most important and fantastic thing about this recipe. You can do whatever you like with the chicken but the sauce is what your paying attention to for sure. I leave out the Tomatoes and the mushrooms and make broccoli to add in as your eating. You have to watch what kind of cheeses you use. I'm a big fan of the pre-mixed Italian blends they seem to melt very easily and add a unique flavor blend to the sauce. My whole family loves this recipe. Highly recommended!

I have made this probably at least a hundred times. We eat gluten free so I use gluten free pasta and thicken the sauce with cornstarch instead of flour (just mix with one of the cups of milk when it's still cold and stir it in). I also just use 4 cups of milk, no cream, I just don't think it's necessary. I have made it with chicken but it is also very good using shrimp instead or a combination. I also use Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. It still ends up fabulously rich. The amount of salt is a bit much for me. 2 teaspoons is perfect.
This is the most delicious alfredo I've ever made. Amazing.
Made this today for the first time. I have to say, it's pretty darn tasty. I give it 2 thumbs up.
Made exactly as written. Excellent
Added slightly more milk, cheese, and added some broccoli! Love it.

The recipe turned out great! I pretty much followed the recipe but added about half a cup more of Parmesan to make the Alfredo a little thicker (keep in mind it does get thicker once it's cool which was perfect for my family). Overall tasted great, my husband who hated Fettuccini Alfredo even asked for seconds!
Delicious.
Very rich, easy to make
